string-array.name: calculator_desc
string-array.item: Body Mass Index is a screening tool that can indicate whether a person is underweight or if they have a healthy weight, excess weight, or obesity.
Ideal Body Weight tests help to measure the actual weight that people need to maintain for maximal health.
Basal Metabolic Rate test helps to estimate the amount of energy your body burns at rest daily.
Calorie Requirement Calculator is used to estimate the number of calories a person needs to consume each day.
Body Fat Percentage Calculator is used to estimate total body fat percentage based on a specific formula.
Body Surface Area measure or calculator helps to estimate the surface area of a human body.
Carbohyrdates Requirements Calculator helps to estimates the required amounts of carbohydrates that a person needs each day.
Protein Requirements Calculator helps to estimates the required amounts of protein that a person needs each day.
Fat Requirements Calculator helps to estimates the required amounts of fat that a person needs each day.
Total Daily Energy Expenditure is an estimation of how many calories a person burns per day when exercise is taken into account.
Waist-to-Hip Ratio is a quick measure of fat distribution (especially on waist, hips, and buttocks) that may help indicate a person's overall health. It also helps to measure abdominal obesity.
Body Adiposity Index is a practical anthropometric method used to measure body fat percentage.
Blood Alcohol Concentration refers to the amount of alcohol present in the bloodstream.
Lean Body Mass Assessment determines a person's estimated lean body mass (LBM) based on body weight, height, gender, and age.
Fat Free Mass Index is an alternative to body mass index, which helps in estimates a person's muscle mass.
Maximum Heart Rate is most accurately measured using a cardiac stress test, which involves measuring a person's heart function (including heart rate) at periodically increasing levels of exercise.
